subject: Technology
title: Spacewalks: Working Outside the Ship
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Spacewalks: Working Outside the Ship.

hook.text: Imagine stepping outside your house into a vacuum where one wrong move could kill you instantly.

buildup.text: A spacewalk, or EVA, means working outside the station in a pressurized suit that weighs 280 pounds.

discovery.text: The suit is a personal spacecraft. It provides oxygen, temperature control, and protection from micrometeorites.

twist.text: In 2013, Luca Parmitano's helmet started filling with water during a spacewalk. He nearly drowned in space.

climax.text: Despite the danger, spacewalks are essential for repairing equipment that can only be reached from outside.

punchline.text: A spacewalk is the most dangerous commute on or off Earth.

quiz.question: What happened to Luca Parmitano during his 2013 spacewalk?
options: His helmet started filling with water
He lost a tool in space
